content.description:
Siberian Breaks climbs a slightly overhanging arete. The start of the problem is cramped, but the movement is enjoyable.

Sit start with a left hand sloper and a right hand on the arete. From there, bump the right hand up to a decent sidepull on the arete, then blindly bump the right hand again to an edge on the west face, bump through a small edge with the left hand on the face to a sharp edge, gain the edges above, and mantel on top.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. There is a rock directly in the landing that is unavoidable. It pads well though.
content.location: It climbs the west half of Reformation's northeast face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, move up the arete, gain the left hand edge on the face, achieve the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the east half of Reformation's northeast face.
